intro: Sorocea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian sorocea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
